content.description: Trash Panda is a wild roof climb out a completely horizontal roof. There is some choss rock on the bottom (sense the 1 star). This route will need to clean up before its to most people's liking (the crux is clean and 100% safe), but for those who like a little adventure (and grime), this is a fun route that gets a lot of shade in the summer - perfect for hot days. After it gets some ascents, it will probably deserve more stars.
content.location: This route is actually not on the same formation as the other routes on this page - it's located at the top of the hill just above the tunnel that connects Primo and Creekside. Park on the east side of the tunnel (walk up just right of the tunnel toward the power lines and the saddle between the two rock towers)... the climb is obvious from the there. It is located to your south (left), and the route faces north.

content.description: Start up the quartz-y pegmatite crack(3"-4") for the 1st 30 feet, then pull the steep 2 bolt bulge by starting on the left then finishing on the right of the prow. Continue up the blade-like arete.... 9 bolts protect this arete, finishing with 30 feet of natural gear up to 2 inches.
content.protection: 9 bolts with and assortment of natural gear. Some wide gear to 4" is nice for the lower crack. The upper 30' is all natural gear, thin to 2", to the anchor. There is a 2-bolt anchor with chains for descent.
content.location: Park on the east side of Tunnel 6. Walk as if approaching the Play Pen. The easiest ascent of the steep, grassy cone is on looker's right up against the rock walls!

content.description: A steep, cave-like start leads to the slightly leaning wall the rest of the way. There are 12 bolts to 30 feet of thin gear to finish this long pitch.
content.protection: 12 bolts and some thin cams for final 30 feet of crack climbing. There is a 2-bolt anchor with chains for descent.
content.location: Park on the east side of Tunnel 6. Walk as if approaching the Play Pen. The easiest ascent of the steep, grassy cone is on looker's right up against the rock walls!
